name: Premier Inn Dover - Eastern Ferry Terminal

reviews.text: The location was fantastic. Location is right on the water. They did something that no other hotel I have stayed in has done, which is to provide both soft and hard pillows. I perfer soft, which is so very rarely offered. Interior was clean and modern. My stay was quiet enjoyable
reviews.title: Right on the water

reviews.text: We took a day trip from Dover to Calais and stayed one night in the Premier Inn Dover -Eastern Ferry Terminal so we could get the earliest ferry the next morning. We had a family room as we had one of our granddaughters with us, it was clean and spacious and even though we were on the side of the hotel facing the main road it was quiet.
reviews.title: Very Good location

reviews.text: Food in the restaurant for an evening meal was good and reasonably priced with very attentive and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Perfect location for P&O ferries

reviews.text: All in all if you just want a bed, clean room and something good to eat it is hard to beat as the ferry terminal is only yards away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before we got the ferry to Calais. The hotel had it's own parking which was free if you were staying. The check in was friendly and we were asked if we wanted to make a reservation for dinner. The hotel was very busy as a number of ferries had been cancelled earlier that day. We reserved a table and I am glad we did, the restaurant was great and the staff were lovely.
reviews.title: Pre-cruise stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been intending to write this review but some time has slipped by since we stayed there but I doubt much has changed. We booked a room from Canada on their website for the night before leaving on a Baltic cruise in May 2011. Because of the cruise the next day when we got to the hotel it was very busy. That did not matter. The staff was very efficient and friendly. We were checked in to a large, clean comfortable room. It had a huge very comfortable bed. We had an evening meal at their cafe that was very good. Reservations are recommended for the evening meal. Breakfast (included) was hot and good, the same standard of other Premier Inns we have stayed at. That evening we wanted to explore Dover a little and asked the desk staff for recommendations and directions. They were more than happy to help and their pride in their town showed.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: The next morning after breakfast most of the people were trying to check out and get taxis to the ship at the same time. I was absolutely amazed at how efficiently the staff handled the crush. There were some people in that group that were quite impatient and rude but the staff continued to smile and try and help eveyone. We had no problems as the girl on the desk the night before had pre-done our checkout and the morning staff found us a taxi quickly.
reviews.title: Central and very nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we are travelling and we come across a place like this that is efficient and relaxing in what could be a trying experience we do not forget. We will recommend this place to anyone going to Dover.
reviews.title: OK for an overnight stop - but get the seaview rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great overnight stay. We came for the cliffs and castle and chose this hotel on price. It was minutes away from everything with free parking. They have a great all you can eat breakfast (hot for 9 pounds or continental for just over 5 pounds. The room was large and clean. Bed was a bit on the hard side. If you are lucky to get an ocean view it is very spectacular :)
reviews.title: Convenient for Cruise Departure

reviews.text: Nice location, good parking facilities and conveniently close to the ferry terminal and Dover Castle. However, the even numbered rooms face the road and would benefit from improved double-glazing, as it was very noisy. Odd numbered rooms face the sea, so presumably are a lot quieter - and a nicer view! We couldn't work the air-con, so the room was very hot. Tried opening the window but had to close it due to traffic noise. We would stay again for convenience - but only in a sea-view room.
reviews.title: Location is everything

reviews.text: We stayed here one night prior to a cruise. The rooms are quite basic, but completely clean and comfortable. We had two rooms, one facing the harbor and the other facing the road which leads to the ferry. I was concerned that the latter would be noisy, as there was quite a line of trucks on the road when we checked in. My mother reported, however, that she slept well and did not hear the traffic at all, due to the double-pane windows.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff was extremely friendly, personable, and efficient, and they answered all of our questions quite well.
reviews.title: do not stop here if you want to rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked the meal plan, and were glad we did, as our flight from the States had been delayed and we were in no mood to search for a restaurant. The hotel's restaurant was clean and service was good. The food was average, but the price was right!
reviews.title: Premier location for a day trip

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend County Taxi service. We had a wonderful driver (I believe his name was Linden), who took us up to the castle, and then later to our ship. Along the way he showed us many of the sights of Dover, and it was all for one low, fixed price.
reviews.title: very clean

reviews.text: We would definitely stay at this hotel if we take another cruise out of Dover!
reviews.title: Location cannot be beaten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very close to the ferry terminal to France
reviews.title: Great location before the ferry

reviews.text: Food was fantastic for the price
reviews.title: Premier Inn - Dover eastern dock

reviews.text: Friendly helpfull staff
reviews.title: Second stay - would still recommend

reviews.text: being over 6ft 2 tall bed seemed a little short
reviews.title: Recomended

reviews.text: We stopped here the night of June 4th as we were getting a ferry to Calais early the next morning.
reviews.title: Great for ferry port

aka: Premier Inn Dover (Eastern Ferry Terminal) Hotel Dover
